TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
> 
>

> 
> If you were forced to then would you?
> 

No.
Why did they stop making you do them then?

> 8 hours ago, Barzon Kerman said:
> 
> 
> Do moderators still have to do team building exercises as mentioned on the Moderation Nation space program/mission report? If so what kind of things do you do?
> 

That thread was our own idea. Any mention of forced team building exercises was just a joke ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") It hasn't ended, by the way. I just need to write up my latest mission report.
How do you become a wiki operator?

Looks like the old Forum Test Thread cannot be repaired? Do you guys know what happend to the old thread and can we get an explanation of the issue? Do we need to worry that it can happen to other threads as well?

Yep, I'm a bit curious ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")

> 
> 
> 11 minutes ago, 4x4cheesecake said:
> 
> 
> Looks like the old Forum Test Thread cannot be repaired? Do you guys know what happend to the old thread and can we get an explanation of the issue? Do we need to worry that it can happen to other threads as well?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Yep, I'm a bit curious ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")
> 

The parsing gasket got caught in the interruption heap. It's technical. They're working on it. Meanwhile, there's a new test thread.

Yes, and we need to uncrumple the ventral bipolar force power core by restarting the malfunctioning power converter, which should compensate for the variance in the  phase circuit. We will also need to rebuild the ventral chroniton pulse assembly and degauss the dorsal graviton buffer. We have to be careful, though, because if we don't balance the muon shift cooling system before we manipulate the gluon bubble compressor, the biaxial nitrogen infusers could be irreparably damaged.

When will there be a 1.7 development thread?

Is it true that KSP is ending its iterations?

> 
> 
> 51 minutes ago, Rover 6428 said:
> 
> 
> When will there be a 1.7 development thread?
> 

We have had them every couple of weeks in the announcements section of the forum. Quite a few details have been released already. 

> 
> 
> 51 minutes ago, Rover 6428 said:
> 
> 
> Is it true that KSP is ending its iterations?
> 

On the contrary. They have now gone into a new regular-ish release cycle, so we can probably expect many more versions to come.

>
